result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jenna C Pleet

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Jenna C Pleet in court with attorney Ryan Drengler. Defendant Jenna C Pleet in custody. Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Both cases heard: 15CM171, 15CM260
11:07 a.m.  Court calls the cases. 

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of: 
 15CM171 Counts 1 thru 3 - NO CONTEST

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty 15CM171 Counts 1 thru 3.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.

15CM260 is dismissed and read-in. 

Atty Constable makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty Drengler makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Court questions the defendant. 
Defendant makes statements to the Court. 

BY THE COURT:
15CM171 Count 1 - 
Serve 30 days jail, STAYED
13 days credit.
Huber if approved by jail administration. 
Placed on probation for a period of 2 years:
Pay costs including the DNA surcharge.  To be paid during the period of probation. 
Submit DNA sample.  
AODA, if she hasn't had one done recently, and comply with treatment recommendations including inpatient, outpatient or intensive treatment.
Maintain absolute sobriety. 
Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment.
Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription. 
Get all medications from one pharmacy.
Sign all necessary releases so agent can monitor prescription, medication and usage.
Engage in any counseling deemed appropriate by her agent. 
Probation can be transferred to Wood County.

15CM171 Count 2 - 
Serve 30 days jail, concurrent, STAYED
Huber if approved by jail administration. 
Placed on probation for a period of 2 years, concurrent:
Comply with all conditions in Count 1. 
Pay costs including the DNA surcharge. 
Probation can be transferred to Wood County.

15CM171 Count 3 - 
Serve 180 days jail, concurrent with Counts 1 & 2, STAYED
Huber if approved by jail administration. 
Court will allow last 90 days on electronic monitoring if approved by the RISK assessment and jail administration. 
Placed on probation for a period of 2 years, concurrent:
Comply with all conditions in Count 1. 
Pay costs including the DNA surcharge. 
Probation can be transferred to Wood County.

Prosecuting Atty David R. Knaapen appeared for State of Wisconsin. Attorney  Ryan Drengler in court for Defendant Jenna C Pleet. Defendant Jenna C Pleet appeared by video.
Both files heard: 15CM171, 15CM260

Attorney/Defendant received copy of criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of charges and maximum penalties.
Attorney/Defendant waives reading of complaint.

NOT GUILTY plea entered.

BY THE COURT: Bond Continued on both files.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 14, 2015 at 10:00 am.
$500 cash bond: Comply with conditions of all bonds in her pending cases.

Defendant Jenna C Pleet appeared by video. Prosecuting Atty Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for State of Wisconsin. Court questions reason for missing court prior.  Defendant state she doesn't have a current mailing address.  ADA Constable request the previous $500 cash bond in 15CM171 to be forfeited.

BTC: $500 cash bond: Comply with conditions of all bonds in her pending cases. 

The prior $500 bond posted in 15CM171 is forfeited.

ADDRESS INFO for Jenna C Pleet
Current: 240 Ash Street, Wisconsin Rapids, WI 54494   (Effective: 08-12-2015)
Prior: 630 Wisconsin Street, Wisconsin Rapids, WI 54494

Attorney Ryan Drengler in court. Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Both files heard: 15CM171, 15CM260

1:59 p.m.  Court calls the cases. 
Atty Drengler does not know where his client is. 
Atty Constable indicates a warrant was previously ordered in 15CM171 on 5/18 with a $500 cash alternative for failing to appear for the initial appearance on that case.  Requests a warrant be issued with a $1,000 cash alternative. 

BY THE COURT:  Court finds complaint shows probable cause.  Criminal warrant with a $500 cash alternative in 15CM260.
